workflow.name: Personal finance tracker with Telegram Bot, Google Gemini Vision, and Sheets
workflow.description:
# Personal Finance AI Agent ‚Äì Telegram Bot (n8n Workflow)

A fully automated Telegram-based personal finance tracker that:
- Accepts receipts as **images**, **PDFs**, or plain text  
- Uses Google Gemini Vision for OCR & intelligent extraction  
- Logs every expense into **Google Sheets**  
- Stores receipt images/PDFs in **Google Drive**  
- Answers natural-language spending questions ("How much did I spend on food last month?", "Compare this month vs last month", etc.)

Built entirely with **n8n** ‚Äì 100% self-hostable, no-code/low-code.

---

## How It Works (Overview)

1. **You send a message to your Telegram bot**  
   ‚Üí Photo of a receipt, PDF, or just text like "Nov 10 ‚Äì 2500 NGN ‚Äì Uber"

2. **Switch node** detects the message type:
   - Photo ‚Üí Branch 0
   - Document (PDF/other) ‚Üí Branch 1  
   - Pure text ‚Üí Branch 2 (goes straight to query agent)

3. **Receipt Processing Path (Images & PDFs)**
   - Files downloaded from Telegram ‚Üí uploaded to Google Drive ("Monthly receipts" folder)
   - Images ‚Üí OCR with Gemini Vision  
     PDFs ‚Üí native PDF text extraction
   - Extracted text + Drive link ‚Üí merged ‚Üí sent to Gemini AI Agent
   - AI extracts: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) ‚Ä¢ Amount (NGN) ‚Ä¢ Description ‚Ä¢ Category  
     (food, transportation, subscriptions, takeouts, entertainment, gift, electricity, repairs, other stuffs)
   - Clean JSON ‚Üí appended to Google Sheets ‚Üí friendly confirmation sent back

4. **Spending Query Path (Text questions)**
   - Second AI Agent with access to the live Google Sheet + calculator + memory
   - Answers anything: totals, breakdowns, comparisons, trends, percentages‚Ä¶

---

## Live Google Sheet (Template)
You can make a copy of the exact sheet the bot uses:  
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kwWJquPpwL9vt9U06a4f4phXq5jZjaGazvh2V69FGoc/edit?usp=sharing

Just click **File ‚Üí Make a copy** and use your copy‚Äôs ID in the workflow.

---

## Setup Steps (Step-by-Step)

### Prerequisites
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- Telegram bot (created via @BotFather)
- Google account

### 1. Create Telegram Bot
1. Message @BotFather ‚Üí `/newbot`
2. Copy the bot token
3. In n8n ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí New **Telegram API** credential ‚Üí paste token

### 2. Google Setup
1. **Make a copy** of the sheet above  
   ‚Üí Copy the new spreadsheet ID from the URL
2. Create a Google Drive folder called **"Monthly receipts"** (or any name) ‚Üí copy folder ID
3. Enable Gemini API in Google Cloud (or use your existing key)
4. In n8n create these credentials:
   - Google Sheets OAuth2 API
   - Google Drive OAuth2 API
   - Google Gemini (PaLM) API

### 3. Import Workflow
- Copy the full JSON from the original file
- n8n ‚Üí Workflows ‚Üí Import ‚Üí paste ‚Üí Import

### 4. Update IDs & Credentials
After import, configure these nodes:

| Node                              | What to Change                                      |
|-----------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| Telegram Trigger + all Telegram nodes | Your Telegram credential                            |
| Google Sheets nodes               | Your Google Sheets credential + new Sheet ID        |
| Google Drive "Upload file" nodes  | Paste your "Monthly receipts" folder ID             |
| Gemini nodes                      | Your Gemini credential                              |
| AI Agent & AI Agent1              | Verify model, memory, tools are connected           |

### 5. Activate & Test
- Click **Activate**
- Start chatting with your bot on Telegram

**Test commands**  
- Send a photo/PDF receipt  
- Type: `How much did I spend last month?`  
- Type: `Show me food spending this month vs last month`

You‚Äôll get instant replies and see new rows appear in your sheet!

---

## Features
- Zero manual entry ever again
- Works with handwritten receipts
- Smart categorization
- Natural-language spending insights
- All data stays 100% in your Google account
- Completely private & self-hostable
- NGN-native (Naira)

Never track expenses manually again!

options.systemMessage:
=You are a Telegram chatbot for receipt tracking, expense queries. You assist users by processing receipts,you also have access to a google sheet where all expenseses are logged and a calculator to perform complex math.

Always analyze the user's message first.

1. Message Analysis:
   - If contains a binary file ({{ $json.data }}): Process as receipt via OCR.
   - If contains receipt-like text in {{ $json.data }}
(e.g., "Date: 2025-09-10, Amount: 5000 NGN, Food"): Parse as receipt.

2. Receipt Processing (Binary or Text):
   - For binary: Use OCR on the receipt (image/PDF, in Naira).
   - For text: Parse details from text.
   - Extract:
     - Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
     - Amount (NGN, number, e.g., 1500)
     - Description (brief summary at least a sentence)
     - Category: food, transportation, subscriptions, takeouts, other stuffs, gift, electricity, Repairs,entertainment 
   - Defaults: date=today ({{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.date }}), amount=0, category="other stuffs" if unclear.
  - Output "data" as: {"date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "amount": 1500, "description": "Brief summary", "category": "category_name"}
   - "message": User-friendly confirmation, e.g., "Receipt processed! Date: [date], Amount: [amount] NGN, Category: [category]."

3. Tone & Rules:
   - Friendly, concise, professional.
   - For errors (e.g., invalid file, unreadable text): Output {"type": "error", "data": {}, "message": "Sorry, couldn't process‚Äîtry again!"}
   - Always output valid JSON.
   - For receipts: {"type": "receipt", "data": {"date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "amount": number, "description": "string", "category": "string"}, "message": "string"}
   - For spend queries: {"type": "spend", "data": {"start_date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "end_date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "category": "string" | null}, "message": "string"}
   - For general/financial queries: {"message": "string"}
- always maintain the Json structure and where information doesn't exsist leave as empty ""
- if amount is equaly to 0 leave as empty ""

Output: JSON as specified

{
  "type": "receipt",
  "data": {
    "date": "2025-09-10",
    "amount": 1500,
    "description": "Groceries from supermarket",
    "category": "food"
  },
  "message": "Receipt processed! Date: 2025-09-10, Amount: 1500 NGN, Category: food."
}

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful Telegram finance assistant that answers spending questions and provides financial advice. You have access to expense data and can perform calculations.

How to handle user queries:

Spending Questions:
When users ask about their expenses, analyze:
- Time period (any month, year, or custom range)
- Categories (if specified) 
- Calculation type (totals, percentages, averages, comparisons)

Use available data and calculator for:
- Total spending amounts
- Category breakdowns and percentages
- Monthly/quarterly/yearly comparisons
- Spending trends and patterns
- Average spending calculations

Provide clear, detailed answers with specific numbers and helpful insights.

Financial Advice:
- Offer practical tips for budgeting, saving, and money management
- Explain financial concepts in simple terms
- Provide supportive, non-judgmental guidance

General Responses:
- Be friendly, concise, and helpful
- If you can't answer something: "I don't have enough data to answer that question yet."
- Always respond in natural, conversational language

Examples:
- "How much did I spend on food last month?" ‚Üí "Last month you spent 15,400 NGN on food across 12 transactions."
- "What percentage of my spending was transportation?" ‚Üí "Transportation made up 22% of your September spending, totaling 8,500 NGN."
- "Show me my top spending categories" ‚Üí "Your top categories last month were: Food (35%), Transportation (22%), and Entertainment (15%)."
- "Compare my spending this month vs last month" ‚Üí "Your spending this month is 18% lower than last month. You saved the most on dining out and transportation.

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets1

parameters.content:
# Trigger/ start workflow

This is where the workflow begins with a telegram node

then a switch node that would determine if the input form telegram is an image, text or pdf

# Sorting, extracting and OCR

_Here images are OCRed with Gemini model or any model of your choice 
_ PDF are extracted with the extract with the native extract form PDF node
_ Everything is aggregated with an aggregator node which is then passed to an LLM

# Process text Enquires 

This section processes financial questions, advice and information about financial spend, the Gemini model has access to your excel sheet, a simple memory and calculator to aid with all the enquires it gets.

# Invoice Processing
   The agent processes the information form the invoice and then appends to your excel sheet

# Personal Finance Telegram Bot: Automated Receipt Tracking & Expense Queries

This workflow turns your Telegram bot into a smart personal finance assistant. Send receipt photos/PDFs or text, and AI (Google Gemini) extracts date, amount (in NGN), description, and category ‚Äî then logs it to Google Sheets with the image uploaded to Google Drive.

Ask natural language questions like "How much did I spend last month?" or "Total on food this month?" and get AI-powered summaries, breakdowns, and insights using your logged data.

Perfect for effortless expense tracking without manual entry!

## How it works
- Telegram Trigger detects incoming messages/photos/documents.
- Switch routes: images/PDFs ‚Üí OCR/analysis/upload ‚Üí AI parsing ‚Üí log to Sheets.
- Text queries ‚Üí AI agent queries Sheets data + calculator for answers.
- Confirmation/summary replies sent back to Telegram.

## Setup steps
1. Connect credentials: Telegram API, Google Sheets (OAuth2), Google Drive, Google Gemini API.
2. Update Google Sheets node with your spreadsheet ID (pre-filled, but verify).
3. Update Google Drive upload nodes with your folder ID for receipts.
4. Activate the workflow and send a test message/receipt to your bot.

## Customization tips
- Edit AI Agent prompts to add/remove categories or refine parsing.
- Adjust memory window or add more tools for advanced queries.

message.text: How much did I spend last month?

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
